About the Company

Are you a person who is excited about Data Science and Artificial Intelligence (AI)?

Interested in being part of a growing multinational, delivering end-to-end projects in the international space?

Code Ninja houses 3 different US-based tech startups. And our most data-centric startup is gearing up to grow its data science team:

ImportGenius, one of the US-based tech startups is the pioneer company in data analytics for the global import/export industry. Our trade data is used by businesses the world over to gain an advantage over their competitors. The insights we produce using our trade data have been used by analysts and journalists to predict the iPhone launch even before the official announcement, track counterfeit money flowing into Venezuela, and most recently to discover priceless antiques being shipped out of Russia by oligarchs.

At ImportGenius we are always finding ways to build tools that allow our customers to discover powerful intelligence from global trade data.

Apply now to join our team as Data Scientist for Import Genius!

About the Job

ImportGenius has access to the real-time complete import and export records of 18 countries. As our new Data Scientist at Import Genius you will manage the process from PoC stage and to design and implement/deploy scalable solutions for our customers, in the area of Natural Language Processing, Predictive Modeling and Decision Support Systems. This includes owning-up the quality of the deliverables, facilitating for a successful project delivery. As a Data Scientist you will ensure the quality throughout the process: building and validating AI models based on structured and unstructured data. You will collaborate closely with Product Managers in conceptualizing viable Data Science solutions for our customers and work together with our Data and Software Engineers in delivering production-grade Data Science solutions. In your capacity as Data Scientist it will also be expected of you to guide your younger colleagues through the project life-cycle.

Throughout customer engagements, you have the opportunity to deep-dive into the customer’s data and translate this to optimal business solutions. You will drive the technical discussions to qualify that the designed and developed solution is addressing the customer's business problem. To succeed in this role, we believe that you will establish and maintain a professional and trusted relationship with the customer, providing continuous guidance during the customer engagement.

Key responsibilities to highlight

Own the delivery process from PoC stage and to design and implement/deploy scalable solutions for our customers, in the area of NLP, Predictive Modeling and Decision Support Systems.

Define and qualify data requirements necessary to implement the Data Science solution

Understand customer business problem and identify the right Data Science solution to address the problem

Define the data requirements necessary to implement the Data Science solution

Conduct Exploratory Data Analysis and develop AI models for addressing concrete business problems

Validate both the technical performance, as well as the business value of the developed AI solutions

Write production-grade Python code for deploying the developed AI models together with our engineering team

We envisage you to be an ambitious and goal-oriented individual with the desire for achievement to reach goals, having the drive and aspiration to become and stay a subject matter expert, and an authority in the area of specialization. To succeed in this role, it will be crucial to demonstrate knowledge transfer by being transparent and proactive, and openly share knowledge, experience and information. You will be part of a cross-functional team, and collaborate closely with Data Scientists, Data/Software Engineers and Solutions Architects.
Desired competency & experience

A Bachelor degree in a relevant field (Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Statistics, Physics etc.)

M.Sc. or PhD degree in a relevant field (Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Statistics, Physics etc.) is a plus.

2 - 5 years of professional experience in analyzing, exploring, building and validating AI models based on structured and unstructured data

Practical experience with developing impactful AI models for specific solutions (e.g. text analytics applications)

Working experience with one or more of the following ML frameworks: scikit-learn, TensorFlow, Keras, pytorch

Fluency in Python, software engineering concepts and best practices

Knowledge SQL, Glue, and in agile methods, such as Spark or similar large-scale data processing frameworks and code versioning tools (git).

Experience in working with large datasets. You should be comfortable querying and filtering large amounts of data, cleaning up data programmatically, and slicing quick samples of the data.

Experience in building complex reports, queries, and dashboards at scale

Up to date with current trends in AI, Data Science, and Big Data Algorithms.

While we don’t expect you to be an NLP expert, knowledge in this domain will be beneficial.

Innovative “out of the box” thinking. This role is central to the company’s competitive advantage in providing unique insights using publicly available data

A positive “Can do” attitude

High attention to detail

Practical Information

Location for this job: Manila, Philippines

Language requirements: Professional level English, written & spoken

Application deadline: ASAP. We will evaluate candidates continuously

Visa requirements: Should have a valid work permit/visa for the Philippines. We are looking for someone who is ideally already based in the Philippines and that could start relatively quickly. If you are located outside of the Philippines, please detail in your application when you are planning to move here and when you could start.

Makati, Philippines
Hybrid Work Setup

About Citco
Citco is a global leader in fund services, corporate governance and related asset services with staff across 80 offices worldwide. With more than $1 trillion in assets under administration, we deliver end-to-end solutions and exceptional service to meet our clients’ needs.
For more information about Citco, please visit www.citco.com
About the Team & Business Line:
Proprietary software solutions and innovation are at the core of what differentiates Citco in the alternative investment space. Through our network of global development centres, Citco invests heavily in technology development, security, and infrastructure to ensure our clients continue to receive award-winning products that underpin our commitment to service excellence.
As a core member of our Product Development team you will work with dedicated professionals to ensure our clients maintain access to their critical information assets while keeping Citco ahead of industry trends.
Your Role:
You will be working in a cross-functional team, using agile methodologies to build cloud native applications for the financial services industry. You will contribute to overall CICD and ensure quality is maintained through early and frequent use of automated testing.
Participate and contribute on all team activities such as sprint planning, daily scrums and retrospectives
Plan, create and execute test cases applicable to user stories
Build and execute automated system and performance tests for APIs and web applications
Work closely with other engineers and product owners to define testing needs
Automate and scale test execution and analysis in AWS
Help determine and then ensure agreed up test metrics are met
Perform reviews and ensure the quality of the team’s work

About You:
Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent
4+ years of experience in test automation
1+ year of experience testing in an agile cross-functional team
2+ years of experience with automated acceptance testing
1+ years of experience working with AWS
Extensive experience with CICD tools such as CodePipeline or Jenkins
Experience with Selenium based test automation frameworks such as Robot Framework or WebdriverIO
Experience with automated calculation and data validation is a plus
Experience with Natural Language Processing and Machine Learning Model Testing a plus
Knowledge of performance testing frameworks including Mocha and Jest.
Proficiency in programming in languages such as Javascript and Python
Experience with source code management tools, GIT or CodeCommit preferred
Overall experience with REST, messaging and relational databases (NoSQL is a plus)
Experience working with Node and React is an asset
Must be self-motivated and driven, with demonstrated knowledge and skills in: Creativity, technical analysis, problem solving, communication and client service.
Knowledge of financial industry is highly desirable
Our Benefits
Your well being is of paramount importance to us, and central to our success. We provide a range of benefits, training and education support, and flexible working arrangements to help you achieve success in your career while balancing personal needs. Ask us about specific benefits in your location.

We recognize diversity as a source of organizational pride and strength. We have made it a priority to reflect our nation’s evolving diversity in the people we hire, and the culture we create in our organization.
Citco welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection.

Corporate culture and guiding principles:
TP ICAP is a global firm of professional intermediaries that plays a pivotal role in the world’s financial, energy and commodities markets.
Operating through our core businesses, Tullett Prebon, ICAP, PVM, Mirexa Capital, Liquidnet, and Parameta Data Services, we create strong networks in person and through technology. We provide comprehensive analysis and insight into market conditions and long-term trends. We combine data, knowledge and intelligence into contextual insight and commercial guidance. By engaging with our clients, and providing innovative products and services, we enable our clients to transact with confidence, facilitating the flow of capital and commodities around the world, enhancing investment and contributing to economic growth.
We are known in the market for our Honesty, Integrity, and Excellence in the provision of service to our clients. Above all else, we Respect our clients and each other, without bias. Employees are expected to uphold the values and principles of our cultural framework in performance of their job duties.
Role Overview:
This role sits within the Global IT Security department and operates as a global team responsible for cyber security at TP ICAP.
The Senior Cyber Security Engineer has the remit of proactively driving development of the cyber security capability in line with the evolving threat landscape. This includes; vulnerability management, access control, security platform engineering, detection and response activities. Coordinate with offensive security personnel to improve security posture based on Red/Purple team campaign findings.
The role requires a self-starter, capable of taking the initiative either as part of a group or working independently. An ability to problem solve through solutions engineering to deliver defined objectives is essential. This requires ingenuity and resourcefulness to achieve cyber security orientated goals, that also facilitate our business needs. Personal career development is strongly supported, especially where directly applicable to ongoing workstreams.
Overall, the Senior Cyber Security Engineer is required to have a willingness to learn and adapt, in order to accomplish outcomes that improve the overall cyber security posture of the group. Fundamental to this is the ability to exercise an offensive security mindset.
Job Duties:
Maintain knowledge of current ATP TTPs
Maintain knowledge of security tool landscape
Security platform engineering and projects
Vulnerability identification and remediation
SOC support as point of escalation
Penetration test report remediation
Privileged access management
Red/Purple offensive security activities
Incident response and forensics
Proactively identify opportunities for control improvements
Develop strong relationships with stakeholders across the business
Provide security tooling metrics
General Skills:
Strong communication skills
Comprehensive cyber security knowledge
Project management & organizational skills
Ability to interpret and analyse technical information
Attention to detail and data accuracy
Essential Technical Skills:
Experience implementing vulnerability management, SIEM, PAM, IDS/IPS, EDR, DLP and AV platforms
Comfortable with Windows and Linux operating systems
Solid knowledge of networking, active directory and web applications
Experience with reviewing and implementing Cloud security controls
Intermediate level knowledge of incident response processes for OS and network level events
Experience using scripts for automation
Desirable Technical Skills:
Incident response and forensics
Offensive security experience
Degree level accreditation or equivalent experience
OSCP, CEH or SANS certification

Integration Engineer (Workato)
Job Description:
Five9 is a leader in Cloud based Call Center solutions and one of the Bay Area's fastest growing companies. To complement our rapid growth, we are actively looking for a motivated and technology-savvy ERP Application Analyst to join our Enterprise Application Development team, who can implement the best practices, develop, optimize and support the systems for the IT-Finance team. Our headquarters is located in San Ramon, CA, and we continue to expand globally. We offer a very competitive base salary, full benefits package, and stock options. Five9 is a high-energy environment with lots of room for personal and professional growth.
The ideal candidate will have exceptional technical, analytical and problem-solving skills and be comfortable interacting with all levels of the organization. We are seeking a self-motivated & team-oriented professional, with a bias towards action, who can recognize and make process improvement recommendations and identify new and creative opportunities to leverage Finance Applications to support additional business processes or functions.

About Vestas
Vestas is the energy industry’s global partner on sustainable energy solutions. We are specialised in designing, manufacturing, installing, and servicing wind turbines, both onshore and offshore.

We consider ourselves pioneers within the industry, as we continuously aim to design new solutions and technologies to create a more sustainable future for all of us. Job Title: Sr. Principal Security Engineer, SIEM Engineer
Company Rating: 3.5 out of 5 stars from 485 employee ratings
Job Description:
Please return soon to complete your dream job application!

Sr. Principal Security Engineer, SIEM Engineer
Req id: 31020
Makati City, National Capital Region (NCR), PH
OPENTEXT - THE INFORMATION COMPANY

As the Information Company, our mission at OpenText is to create software solutions and deliver services that redefine the future of digital. Be part of a winning team that leads the way in Enterprise Information Management.

Job Description – Sr. Principal Security Engineer, SIEM Engineer

ENABLING THE DIGITAL WORLD

OpenText enables the digital world by simplifying, transforming, and accelerating enterprise information needs, on premises or in the cloud. We embrace all things digital and are committed to being the Best Place to Work for our Employees in over 140 locations around the world.

We obsess over our customers to ensure they are wildly successful in embracing the Digital World. Our customers entrust us with their most important information, we need to be their most trusted partner. What we do, we do well. What we create, we do purposefully to impact the world. If you believe in this and are passionate about enabling the Digital World, then let OpenText turn your career vision into reality.



The Opportunity:

The Sr. Principal Security Engineer, SIEM Engineer is a member of the Information Protection Center providing subject matter expertise. You are responsible for the health, performance, and capacity planning of our SIEM platform including the management and operation of the SIEM infrastructure. This hands-on role requires a deep technical knowledge of security technologies and must have a solid understanding of information security and networking.
You are great at:

Providing subject matter expertise for all SIEM components and design.
Researching, documenting, and implementing security best practices to continually improve the deployment and use of the SIEM.
Coordinating and conducting event collection, log management, event management, and compliance automation.
Researching, analyzing, and understanding common and complex log sources.
Providing expert guidance regarding the implementation of rules and event correlation for the SIEM environment.
Developing detection rules to support alerting and response capabilities for our SOC services.
Providing day to day event parsing and repairing of events that have missing or incorrect information.
Troubleshooting issues with log sources or systems, with internal IT teams and vendors, providing resolution to defects or performance issue as needed.
Creating detailed reports on the status of the SIEM that also includes metrics on items such as number of logging sources, log collection rate, and server performance.
Design and build dashboards in the SIEM.
Develop, implement, and execute standard procedures for the administration, management, and lifecycle of the SIEM.
Participating in incident response and technical investigations as needed.
Performing in-depth analysis of current threat activity and trends
Mentoring and training security team members on the SIEM deployment and operation.
Providing support for audits and gathering of artifacts for FedRAMP, ISO27001, PCI, SOC1 & SOC2, etc.

What it takes:

BS in Computer Science, Cyber Security, Information Assurance, or Information Security preferred.
5 - 8 years SIEM experience that includes leading SIEM deployments and optimization.
Minimum 10 years working experience with LogRhythm and/or Splunk.
Understands and can articulate how the SIEM platform and service provides value to the company.
Experience in a large enterprise environment analyzing security event data for attack patterns and understanding attacker tactics.
Experience in developing SIEM correlation rules to detect new threats beyond current capabilities.
Working knowledge of Threat intelligence to interpret IOC’s and translating them for SIEM alerting.
Understanding of OSI layers, network protocols (IP, ICMP, TCP, UDP), network services (DNS, DHCP, HTTP), routing protocols
Scripting skills (Python, PowerShell, Regular Expressions, Lua)
Experience with Windows and Linux Operation Systems
Experience creating and refining metrics to articulate and measure program performance.
Able to work independently and efficiently, as well as with others, to meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
Self-motivated and detail oriented.
Possess excellent writing and communication skills.
CISSP, GCIH, CISA, CISM, or other industry certifications preferred.
Work Location
The location for the position is in the Philippines.
Salary Plan
Annualized Total Cash Compensation

Corporate culture and guiding principles:
TP ICAP operates at the heart of the world’s financial, energy and commodities markets.
We are professional intermediaries playing a pivotal role in the world’s financial markets, covering FX, Rates, Credit, Equities, Energy & Commodities.
Globally, we are a leading provider of market participants, with execution via a range of regulated venues, covering a full spectrum of over-the-counter (OTC) asset classes. Matching buyers and sellers, we facilitate the development of liquidity and price discovery in these markets and provide insight and context to our clients. We operate a hybrid model where brokers provide business-critical intelligence to clients. It’s supplemented by proprietary screens for historical data, analytics and execution functionality.
Our clients include banks, insurance companies, pension and hedge funds, asset managers, energy producers and refiners, as well as risk and compliance managers and charities.
We are known in the market for our Honesty, Integrity and Excellence in the provision of service to our clients. Above all else, we Respect our clients and each other, without bias. Employees are expected to uphold the values and principles of our cultural framework in performance of their job duties.
Job duties:
The role sits within the Global Network Operations team which is responsible for maintaining the operation of ICAP data networks. The team also carries out project based work where required and in conjunction with the Global Network Engineering team.
The Network Operations team is responsible for resolving day-to-day issues, incidents, problems and changes within the network estate. This will include incident diagnosis and management, repair and recovery, monitoring, problem management, root cause analysis and deployment on a number of network platforms.
Support network incident and change activities in a 24x7 global operations team on assigned shift.
Troubleshoot and isolate network incidents within large-scale complex IT environments.
Proactively manage network components in order to prevent incidents.
Utilize all Network Monitoring and Management tools in an efficient and timely manner.
Support changes to the production network while following all required change procedures.
Process internal and external client requests for network changes in line with agreed policies and procedures.
Follow escalation procedures and process, recommend improvements when required.
Review, track and update network operations policies, standards, and processes.
Review production changes for adherence against agreed policy and best practices.
Work collaboratively with ICAP’s other IT infrastructure teams.
Fulfil any additional / ad hoc duties as required to meet the needs of the business

Job Description
Join Manulife’s Identity & Access Management global team and help protect our company and customer’s information. Join our team to execute our 5-year IAM roadmap to provide global protections and automation to Manulife, on track to be the most digital, customer-centric global company in the industry.
Our team is providing a global service to ensure the right people have the right access to the right information and data at Manulife. We are using the Sailpoint IdentityIQ (IIQ) platform for access controls and are expanding capabilities and coverage. Join us on this journey and join our team !
ASSOCIATE SAILPOINT ENGINEER
Job Profile: Associate Security Engineer
Responsibilities
Act on behalf of Enterprise Technology & Services to provide an effective and efficient Access Governance Service centered around Sailpoint’s IdentityIQ (IIQ) product
Configure applications in IIQ to import data via DB (JDBC) connectors and feed file imports
Develop custom queries, rules, workflows & coding features to improve access governance capabilities
Coordinate the promotion and testing of application configurations through test regions with IIQ Admins, Sailpoint Analysts and QA resources
Collaborate with application SMEs and DBAs to optimize data connectivity, aiming for direct provisioning
Manage application onboarding tasks in Jira in a timely manner
Monitor and manage data import, aggregation and refresh failures
Analyze the user-base of applications, perform bottom-up analysis and resulting recommendations for Role-Based Access Controls (RBAC)
Create and manage Roles in IIQ and ensure active ownership by Role Owners
Provide technical consulting for IIQ upgrades, defects and enhancements
Align with the Access Governance Strategy to ensure a successful service delivery
Identify data and process improvement ideas; contribute to enhance the maturity of the Access Governance service
Ideal Qualifications
Experience configuring applications, rules, workflows, forms and other Sailpoint components
Experience with JAVA /J2EE, JavaScript, BeanShell; strong java debugging skills
Experience with developing elegant, maintainable, testable, and reusable code
Exposure to Web Services and REST APIs
Role-Based (RBAC) deployment experience is a plus

About John Hancock and Manulife
John Hancock is a unit of Manulife Financial Corporation, a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. We operate primarily as John Hancock in the United States, and Manulife globally, including Canada, Asia and Europe. We provide financial advice, insurance and wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. Assets under management and administration by Manulife and its subsidiaries were CAD$1.3 trillion (US$1.1 trillion) as of June 30, 2021. Manulife Financial Corporation trades as MFC on the TSX, NYSE, and PSE, and under 945 on the SEHK. Manulife can be found at manulife.com .
One of the largest life insurers in the United States, John Hancock supports more than 10 million Americans with a broad range of financial products, including life insurance , annuities , investments , 401(k) plans , and education savings plans . Additional information about John Hancock may be found at johnhancock.com .

Job Description:
Every day, Global Payments makes it possible for millions of people to move money between buyers and sellers using our payments solutions for credit, debit, prepaid and merchant services. Our worldwide team helps over 3 million companies, more than 1,300 financial institutions and over 600 million cardholders grow with confidence and achieve amazing results. We are driven by our passion for success and we are proud to deliver best-in-class payment technology and software solutions. Join our dynamic team and make your mark on the payments technology landscape of tomorrow.
At ACTIVE Network, we are building solutions for all types of activity organizations helping them automate, simplify and grow their businesses. Our cloud technology powers business events, community programs, parks departments, local attractions, faith-based organizations, sports events, and outdoor activities. We deliver technology that changes the way the world gets active.
Job Description
We are looking for a skilled and experienced Data Engineer to join our team! As a Data Engineer, you will be responsible for data preparation jobs, data analysis and data reporting. You will be responsible for performing technical troubleshooting and providing technical expertise for ETL jobs.
The job role might also require you to learn new tools and technologies fast, and you should have in-depth database knowledge as well as basic programming and scripting skills. You will help to build efficient and stable data pipelines which can be easily maintained in the future. You should have expertise in the design, creation, management, and business use of large datasets and databases.
Responsibilities
Developing and implementing ETL processes
Developing and maintaining integration tools and utilities
Design table structures, developing stored procedures, views, etc and troubleshooting issues across different applications
Develop, maintain and troubleshoot SSRS reports
Performing root cause analysis and providing recommendations for resolution
Design, implement, and continuously expand data pipelines by performing extraction, transformation, and loading activities
Gather requirements and business process knowledge in order to transform the data in a way that’s geared towards the needs of end users
Maintain and improve already existing processes
Ensure that the data architecture is scalable and maintainable
Work with the business in designing and delivering correct, high quality data
Investigate data to identify potential issues within ETL pipelines, notify end-users and propose adequate solutions
Prepare documentation for further reference
Skills and Qualifications
Minimum of 4 years of experience in ETL development
Knowledge of ETL concepts, tools and data structures
Ability to perform complex data analysis and troubleshooting
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to work independently
Strong problem-solving skills
Expert level SQL knowledge (query performance tuning, index maintenance, etc.) as well as an understanding of database structure and good design practices
Knowledge of at least one ETL tool (SSIS, CloverDX, Informatica, etc.)
Knowledge of various SQL data storage mechanisms and Big Data technologies a plus
Passionate about complex data structures and problem solving
Ability to pick up new data tools and concepts quickly
Experience parsing, scripting data from text based or non-uniform data sets.
Preferred:
Linux and shell scripting a strong plus
Expert level CloverDX experience, graphs, subgraphs, Job flows, scripting, etc.
7+ years experience working with complex SQL, procedures and ETL data projects
Able to work with unstructured data files
ACTIVE Network Perks & Benefits
Great Working Environment
“5+1” Endowment Insurance; Medical Insurance; Unemployment Insurance; work-related injury insurance and Childbirth Insurance. Housing Accumulation Funds
Commercial Medical Insurance in addition to the Government’s required medical insurance (family members can be added to account)
15 Days PTO (Paid Time off) per year in addition to all the public holidays

Job Title: IT Network Tools and Automation Engineer
Job Description:
About IWG
We’re changing the world of work. We believe that business success is underpinned by the effectiveness of its people. So we made it our mission to help millions of people have a great day at work – every day. With locations in practically every country, city, town and transport hub, and options ranging from an hour’s coworking to multi-year office space leases, we enable people and businesses to work where, when and how they want.
Technology in IWG
We’re focused on delivering seamless digital propositions which allow customers to instantly manage their requirements and position IWG as the “Digital First” workspace provider. As early adopters of the latest technologies - whether it be Artificial Intelligence, Office IoT, Data or Cloud Solutions - we create business value and are constantly striving to find new and improved ways to help our customers. Which is why we’re always on the look-out for intelligent, energetic, self-motivated, and curious individuals. We want to bring about a global workspace revolution and want you to help.
https://www.iwgplc.com/
The Role
The role is ultimately responsible to engineer, develop and support all systems related with monitoring and management of IWG network infrastructure. Main focus will be on strategic direction and implementation of our NMS systems under FCAPS model and framework for Network Management.
What you’ll need to succeed
We are seeking someone who combines a track record in defining and implementing network service management frameworks, with the technical expertise and knowledge in the network space to define the required processes and measurement controls towards IWG providers.
You will need to be proactive and take accountability, having an analytical mindset to identify trends, recurrent tickets raised by IWG employees and customers, identifying current pain points and convert them into improvement actions, always looking to have a continuous service improvement way of thinking, operating at the heart of our Global IT team and playing a leading role in delivering a first-class digital experience for IWG and our customers.
Responsibilities:
Lead the migration of IWG customized network tools to enterprise grade solutions from the marketplace, including inventory, reporting, connectivity, capacity management, access control to network systems and integration with monitoring tools.
Single point of contact for any networking tools integration and development projects with current IWG networking systems.
Accountable for resolving any incident/escalation related to IWG networking tools, identifying the root cause that drove the escalation process to be triggered and identifying action plans to avoid them in the future.
Manage the 3rd party technical relationships for IT Operations.
Work closely with our service providers for the upcoming projects enabling IWG to grow and provide better service to the business and partners.
Proactively manage spend on networking services globally, determining ways to reduce costs without sacrificing customer satisfaction.
Qualifications/Experience:
BSc (Engineering, Computer Science or related) required, MSc or above preferred
+3 years of experience in design, deploy and support Network Management systems
Strong networking/security technical skills – experience managing large scale networks including LAN/WLAN/Security devices and services globally.
Automation experience with some programming language (Python, Perl) and/or Automation Platform (Ansible)
Network Access Control protocols and systems to manage AAA framework to provide access to our customers and our IT systems.
Servicenow platform knowledge and integration with Network Management Systems.
Track record of managing global IT Operational environment to ensure stability, efficient and optimum performance.
Strong ITIL knowledge, process management and implementation experience
Pragmatic, common sense attitude and strong attention to detail are required.
Has worked in a high-growth, fast-paced environment and can deliver results to demanding time scales in an ambiguous environment.
Excellent English verbal and written communication skills.
Hands-on, involved management approach with a relentless attention to detail while simultaneously capable of seeing the bigger picture.
Low ego, high on delivery. Must be prepared to ‘get hands dirty’ and be actively Involved / personally contribute.

The Industrial Engineer shall be responsible in overseeing all activities and projects related to operations processes. Moreover, he shall also be responsible for measuring, monitoring and presentation of operations productivity performances;
· If a new process is implemented, it is the responsibility of the IE to train warehouse staff for standardization. This can include developing instructions and manuals for employees.
· IEs aggregate and summarize information from a variety of sources, the communicate their findings as appropriate. By utilizing analytical skills, areas of improvement can be more easily identified.
· Develop most efficient ways to use people, machines, materials, information, and energy to make a service.
· Ensure continuous improvement tools are being utilized and sustainable high operations performance.
· Gathering and analyzing of operational data shall be made to contribute in the improvement projects.
· Help the company increase productivity.
· Any other duties that maybe assigned from time to time.
Key Competencies and Skills
· Creativity- IE use creativity to design new processes in many kinds of settings to reduce use of resources, time, or labor while accomplishing the same goal.
· Critical-thinking skills – IE create new systems to solve problems related to waste and inefficiency. Solving these problems requires logic reasoning to identify strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions, or approaches to the problems.
· Listening skills- IE offer operate in teams, but they must also solicit feedback from customers, and vendors. They must listen to customers to fully grasp ideas and problems the first time.
· Problem solving skills – IE deals with several issues at once, from worker’s safety to quality assurance.
· Speaking skills – IE sometimes have to explain their instructions to warehouse staff or technicians. Being able to explain concepts clearly and quickly is crucial to preventing costly mistakes and loss of time.
· Writing skills – IE must create documentation for other professionals or for future reference. The documentation must be coherent and explain their thinking clearly so that others can understand the information.
· Graduate of Industrial Engineering coarse
· Computer literacy and familiarity with various computer programs such as MS Office
· Pro-active, innovative, result oriented.
· Good leadership skills

The Territory Manager position, is an entry level position in our Sales Team. The role is highly focused on customer account management and ongoing service, support and sales development with respective accounts. This position primarily focuses on service and selling (additional products, tools and services) to existing accounts with an additional emphasis on new accounts. This is a direct, customer-facing sales role with responsibility to retain existing revenues and close new revenue opportunities with both existing and new customers.
Primary Position Responsibilities:
Effectively provide account management and ongoing service, support, and sales development to respective accounts in a defined geography and sector(s). Implement white spot prospecting to include existing products, new products and innovations, enhanced sustainability and operational efficiencies (water, energy, chemical usage), and where appropriate food safety solutions.
Monitor and report for both respective accounts and aligned Key Accounts by utilizing corresponding tools, such as Sales Funnels, quarterly reporting, market share analysis, and other reports requested by central stakeholders and supervisors.
Work intensely and directly on application expertise and execution delivery, including customer training and merchandising, to reinforce value proposition and brand equity. Hold monthly and quarterly review sessions with customers’ heads of department/ stakeholders.
Grow sales in geographic area and sector(s) by identifying, analyzing, and addressing opportunities for new customer acquisition as well as within existing customers through product and application recommendations.
Continuously focus on sales growth execution and sales target achievement.
Liaise with Applications Team to ensure appropriate service support for respective accounts.
Consult with Key Account Managers or District/Sector Managers to ensure account management support delivered in respective accounts.
Lead on time account receivable collection and prevent overdue
Capabilities and Strengths:

Company Rating: 3.5 out of 5 stars from 249 employee ratings
Job Description:
Join a global professional services leader. We are committed to solving the world’s biggest challenges in the areas of water, energy and urbanization.
GHD’s Marine and Materials Technology team has a reputation of being industry leaders and respected for our professional approach and integrity. Our team delivers professional services in the areas of Marine, Coastal and Remediation Engineering.
GHD Philippine is looking for Materials Engineer to support a wide range of civil projects within a multidisciplinary environment. Being part of a dynamic team staff, you will be responsible for supporting external client projects as well as a large number of internal GHD client groups.
This position offers good variety of work and will see you involved in:
Site surveys of existing infrastructure (particular focus on ports, wharves, jetties, piers), including condition / structural assessments
Use of drones, ROVs, digital data capture tools
Site investigations involving the use of destructive (i.e. core sampling, concrete breakouts) and non-destructive testing (i.e. use of Ground Penetrating Radar / Covermeter surveys, steel Ultrasonic Thickness measurements, cathodic protection potential surveys, concrete resistivity)
Management of sub-contractors for site works such as divers, corers, test laboratories
Evaluate residual life of infrastructure based on site inspection findings and detailed testing outcomes
Develop durability strategies for marine infrastructure projects
Design of cathodic protection systems
Materials and protective coatings specification, the development of corrosion protection and design of suitable cathodic protection
Deliver small to medium projects with minimal supervision
Development of remediation design packages including calculations, modelling, specifications and reporting
Site supervision of remedial contractors
Ensure projects have appropriate QA and peer review by technical specialists
Provide technical expertise on jobs and produce inputs to overall remediation designs, specification and contract management and support projects through other PH business groups and Philippines region offices as required
Provide leadership and planning, and coordinate inputs from sub-consultants and other suppliers for materials and corrosion projects
Technical report writing following both client and GHD guidelines
What you will bring to the team:
Excellent communication skills (verbal and written), having to liaise with clients, contractors, suppliers and other engineering discipline groups on a regular basis;
Experience in remediation in concrete structures;
Asset management background and an ability to manage competing work priorities will be essential;
Strong judgement and critical evaluation skills;
Ideally, we require an ambitious individual who can thrive in a collaborative team environment and contribute to the remediation of existing infrastructure.
Applicants must have working rights in the Philippines.
Recruitment agency applications are not allowed for this position.
#LI-DT1

Why GHD?
Being the best we can be is in our culture.
We are a family of smart, innovative and creative problem solvers. In our employee-owned company, everything feels like it matters more. Challenge us and help us come up with new solutions to ensure water, energy and urbanisation are made sustainable for generations to come.
Our commitment to you
Commitment is a powerful word that defines how we do business, how we serve our clients and how we care for one another. We will support your needs by giving you the tools to do your best work and then recognise achievements. We will set your curiosity free to allow brilliant minds to do their best work. We will invest in new ideas, removing barriers where we can. Finally, we will encourage you to collaborate with thousands of diverse people across our global business.
Who we are
We are committed to solving the world's biggest challenges in the areas of water, energy and urbanisation . GHD is a global professional services company that is a leader in engineering, construction and architectural expertise. Established in 1928, we remain wholly owned by our people. We are 10,000+ diverse and skilled individuals, yet we are proudly ‘One GHD’ across more than 200 offices, spanning five continents – Asia, Australia, Europe, North and South America, and the Pacific region. Delivering extraordinary social and economic outcomes, we are passionate about building lasting relationships with our partners and clients.

Job Description:

Job Purpose
Delivers and maintains IT applications and services in order to realize the organization's strategy in the field of informationtechnology.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Application Software Development - Develop existing and new applications by analyzing and identifying areas for modification and improvement. Develop new applications to meet customer requirements. (Level 7)

Applications Software Maintenance - Monitor, identify, and correct more complex software defects to maintain fully functioning applications software. (Level 6)
Data-driven Product and Service Improvement - Research data from digital product/service performance, customer behavior, and market trends to identify opportunities for product/service improvement. (Level 6)
Design and Conceptualization - Work effectively with cross-functional teams to conceptualize products and services, leveraging data to drive original design ideas and decisions. (Level 7)
Leadership and Direction - Communicate the local action plan; explain how this relates to the function's strategy and action plan and the broader organization's mission and vision; motivate people to achieve local business goals. (Level 6)
Product/Service Development - Deliver defined features, functionality, or outcomes from a designated part of the development/engineering program, selecting the best available approach within established systems. (Level 6)
Project Management - Deliver small-scale or medium-scale projects while working within an established program management plan. (Level 6)
Technical Developments Recommendation - Discuss and recommend technical developments to improve quality of the website/portal/applications software and supporting infrastructure to better meet users’ needs. (Level 6)
Websites/Portals Maintenance and Update - Design and oversee the functionality, usability, and accessibility of business-critical portals/websites using content creation and management tools as well as digital media to ensure that technical continuity is maintained and development standards are met. (Level 6)

BEHAVIORAL COMPETENCIES
Balances Stakeholders - Anticipates and balances the needs of multiple stakeholders. For example, ensures that own efforts meet the needs and requirements of internal and external stakeholders. Works to identify all relevant issues and satisfy the interests of multiple stakeholders during the decision-making process. (Level 5)
Business Insight - Applies knowledge of business and the marketplace to advance the organization's goals. For example, has a sophisticated grasp of business drivers, finds new ways to increase own contribution. Stays attuned to business and industry changes, ensures own activities remain aligned to key objectives. (Level 5)
Collaborates - Builds partnerships and works collaboratively with others to meet shared objectives. For example, encourages coworkers and external partners to work together as a team, and makes sure they get credit for doing so.Encourages people to share their honest views, responds in a non-defensive way when they do. (Level 5)
Instills Trust - Gains the confidence and trust of others through honesty, integrity, and authenticity. For example, models honesty and authenticity and encourages others to be up front with one another. Demonstrates reliabilityand places a strong emphasis on the team meeting its commitments. Fairly represents others' positions. (Level 5)
Manages Complexity - Makes sense of complex, high quantity, and sometimes contradictory information to effectively solve problems. For example, asks questions to encourage others to think differently and enrich their analyses ofcomplex situations. Accurately defines the key elements of complex, ambiguous situations. (Level 5)
Nimble Learning - Learns through experimentation when tackling new problems, using both successes and failures as learning fodder. For example, experiments to find the best possible solution and gains insight from test cases. Makesuse of new concepts and principles when addressing problems. Learns from mistakes to avoid repeating them. (Level 5)
Organizational Savvy - Maneuvers comfortably through complex policy, process, and people-related organizational dynamics. For example, has a firm grasp on organizational culture and politics; connects with key stakeholders and knowswhen to bring something to their attention. (Level 5)
Self-Development - Actively seeks new ways to grow and be challenged using both formal and informal development channels. For example, shows commitment to own leadership development and encourages others to expand their expertise and skills; uses stretch opportunities to broaden capabilities aligned with organizational needs. (Level 5)
Situational Adaptability - Adapts approach and demeanor in real time to match the shifting demands of different situations. For example, serves as an example of adaptability and provides guidance and support to help others adapt to new situations. Considers the needs of clients, constituents, and the organization; shifts priorities appropriately. (Level 5)

TECHNICAL COMPETENCIES
Adaptive Mindset - Works at an advanced level to shift into and out of a mental mindsets associated with assessing the facts and circumstances of the current situation and/or environment and making the appropriate/innovativeadjustments to thinking and work habits to thrive in any scenario. Typically works independently and provides guidance. (Level 4)
Analyze Current State/AS-IS State - Works at an advanced level to understand business context, needs, rules, and architecture, as well as organizational structure, cultures, capabilities, and processes to document the current state of processes and the business.Typically works independently and provides guidance. (Level 4)
Capacity Management -Makes recommendations about provisioning at midterm (capacity plans) and ensures system capacity meets current and future requirements in a cost effective manner. (Level 4)
Cyber Security - Understands the principles of cyber security. Has advanced level of experience in the application of cyber security policies security policies (technical standards and procedures) to the organisation. Knows when toseek advice from the organisation's cyber security experts. (Level 4)
Data Collection and Analysis - Works without supervision and provides technical guidance when required on analyzing data trends for use in reports to help guide decision making. (Level 4)
Data Preparation and Exploration - Prepares data from complex applications and messy data sources, actively builds solutions for others to use. Takes responsibility to build solutions for any identified errors, educates and shares fixes with others. (Level 4)
Define Future State/TO-BE State - Works at an advanced level to envision and document the future state of processes and products by identifying the solution scope, potential value of the future state, and the changes to the process, products, organization infrastructure, capabilities, and technology necessary to achieve the desired future state.Typically works independently and provides guidance. (Level 4)
Networking - Is recognized as specialist in more than one specific technique. Knows how to troubleshoot every issue. Is able to design and implement the majority of the networking setups. Is able to translate business requirements totechnical solutions. (Level 4)
Policy and procedures - Uses comprehensive knowledge and skills to work independently while providing guidance and training to others on developing, monitoring, interpreting and understanding policies and procedures, while making sure they match organizational strategies and objectives. (Level 4)
Polyglotism - Acknowledges that there are different programming paradigms. Is able to be productive in a new language within weeks. (Level 4)
Storage - Is being recognized as specialist in more than one specific technique. Learns from experiences what to expect in certain situations and how to modify plans. Also understands situations as whole parts and is able totranslate business requirements to technical solutions. (Level 4)

Provides expertise, gives advice and analytical support in order to ensure appropriate usage of middleware technologies that he/she masters. (Level 4)
Tech: Engineer: Design and Design for Failure - Designs the feature based on existing design patterns while understanding his/her environment and allowing his/her dependencies to fail. Challenges the existing design patterns. (Level 4)

Applies “defense in depth” to ensure that multiple layers of (Level 4)

Company Rating: 3.9 out of 5 stars from 1,999 employee ratings
Job Description:
ING is looking to recruit a Data Quality Specialist.
Your work environment:
The Data Quality Circle under Risk and Finance Services within ING Hubs Philippines is responsible for activities that support effective data quality monitoring and remediation. It has a key role in supporting the ING’s global data management strategy and is focused on improving data quality across the bank.
The Data Quality Specialist will work with data owners, data stewards, operational teams, IT engineers and other functions within the bank. He/ she will drive the Data Quality definition, measurement and monitoring, analysis of data quality issues and propose data quality remediation actions within the bank, as well as contribute to build a culture of continuous improvement in Data Quality.
Job description:
The Data Quality Specialist will be responsible for the end-to-end management of data quality within the bank.
Key responsibilities:
Understand banking regulations and gather data quality functional requirements in order to define and create data quality rules or standards for identified critical data elements in coordination with data owners, data stewards and operational teams
Work with IT engineers that will implement these data quality functional requirements in tooling. Support the development of Data Quality tooling through testing the data quality programs that have been developed against the functional requirements that were defined.
Track and monitor data quality indicators across the bank through data quality reports and dashboards in compliance with ING’s data quality framework
Perform root cause analysis on prioritized data quality issues to determine appropriate fix forward and fix backward actions or remediation plans.
Work with key stakeholders to align expected turnaround times for remediation, gain approval for suggested remediation actions, coordinate the appropriate action with the teams that are responsible for executing those actions and monitor remediation actions till closure.
Participate in central data cleansing activities to accelerate the data quality remediation.
Who are we looking for?
We are looking for candidates who are skilled, pro-active, passionate, and driven to work in Data Quality. You are a skilled communicator, analytical and a good problem-solver and are able to structure large amounts of data to produce clear views and actionable recommendations, furthermore:
You have knowledge on Data Quality Management practices such as Data profiling, DQ Assessment, Data Cleansing, etc.
You have the ability to understand the business context and regulatory requirements in order to define data quality functional requirements and standards.
You have experience with Data Quality related solutions.
You are experienced in understanding data quality reports and dashboards and can effectively do root-cause analysis of data quality issues.
You have a track record of developing solutions for remediating various data quality issues or a similar role that requires problem solving and stakeholder management.
You are skilled in communicating on complex topics and solutions and must be open to ideas from others. You can create appropriate data quality remediation plans and coordinate effectively to gain approval for the execution.
You are comfortable working in in an international context.
You are transparent, flexible and motivated to make every day a success
You adhere to the ING values of honesty, prudence and responsibility and it is evident for you that your behavior is fully aligned with these values.

Company Rating: 3.9 out of 5 stars from 938 employee ratings
Job Description:
At Arcadis we focus on attracting, retaining and developing people who share our passion and commitment to improve quality of life. In return we offer you the opportunity to transform your world and the world around you, that could be through client work, upskilling yourself, championing equality and inclusion or getting involved in charity work, to name just a few. Our people value different perspectives, they care about the sustainability of our planet and dare to shape the future.
One of our core values is ‘people first’, and supported by our Lovinklaan foundation, we invest in you for the long term, to ensure you reach your full potential. You’ll have the opportunity to own your career and work on industry-defining projects, finding solutions to real challenges that make a difference to people’s lives. You’re encouraged to have a growth mindset and are given the space to develop personally and professionally, building a flexible career that works for you.
Role description:
The purpose of the position is to deliver the tasks and projects assigned to you by either the Design Manager, the Principal or Senior Engineers including; inception, feasibility, preliminary, detailed design and tender management services in line with Client requirements for time, cost and quality.
Role accountabilities:
Under the technical direction of a Principal (or in some cases Senior Engineer) the Engineer shall carry out assigned design tasks on water, wastewater and drainage projects assigned to him. The Engineer shall direct and supervise the work of a number of CAD operators.
The main duties of the role include the following:
Carry out design tasks and calculations through each design phase to the appropriate Philippines or International standards and regulations;
Instruct and supervise up to two CAD Operators;
Ensure that the work is undertaken in compliance with ARCADIS Quality Management System; and
Ensure accurate reporting of time spent and deliverables achieved on all assigned tasks
This role will have specific responsibility for:
Ensuring that all design work is carried out in accordance with ARCADIS standard operating procedures;
Day to day liaison with members of the design Team who are working on the same projects;
The correctness and accuracy of their own work and that of the CAD Operators;
Completion of engineering work within assigned deadline;
Checking and approving all drawings carried out by CAD Operators;
Delivery of assigned tasks in line with Client expectation for time and quality;
Reporting to the Design Manager in a timely manner any matters that are likely to affect assigned deadlines or work quality; and
Actively sharing knowledge and experience with other staff in the Team.
Qualifications & Experience:
Bachelor's Degree in Civil, Sanitary/ Environmental, Electrical, Mechanical Engineer
Experience in water / wastewater design and construction administration
Experience in client facing role with skills to include; preparation and development of proposals, managing client expectations and overall relationship.
Excellent communication skills, both oral and written.
Excellent in MS Office applications
Why Become an Arcadian?
Our work with clients has a direct impact on people’s lives and on the planet. We make moving, living and belonging in cities safer, more resilient and more sustainable. By partnering with our clients as responsible custodians of our earth's resources, we can create a sustainable planet.
We continue to think of new ways to make positive impacts and create better experiences for people; data driven and digital solutions have become part of the Arcadis DNA. Working together with clients and using techniques like design thinking, we can get to the heart of our clients’ most pressing challenges and work together to solve them.
As a global business, we have committed to support five of the UN’s Sustainable Development Goals to ensure that our projects contribute to a better and more sustainable future for all. But it’s not just the work that we do on client projects that benefits communities and our planet. As a global business, we are committed to making a positive impact to society by supporting local communities where we operate.
To help protect our planet, we monitor and measure non-financial information to inform business decisions and reduce our own environmental impact as part of our commitment to be net zero carbon as a global company by 2030.
Our Commitment to Equality, Diversity, Inclusion & Belonging
We want you to be able to bring your best self to work every day, which is why we take equality and inclusion seriously and hold ourselves to account for our actions. Our ambition is to be an employer of choice and provide a great place to work for all our people. At Arcadis, you will have the opportunity to build the career that is right for you. Because each Arcadian has their own motivations, their own career goals. And, as a ‘people ﬁrst’ business, it is why we will take the time to listen, to understand what you want from your time here, and provide the support you need to achieve your ambitions.
Transform Your World
#ArcadisPhilippines

Sophos is a worldwide leader in next-generation cybersecurity, protecting more than 500,000 organizations and millions of consumers in more than 150 countries from today’s most advanced cyberthreats. Powered by threat intelligence, AI and machine learning from SophosLabs and SophosAI, Sophos delivers a broad portfolio of advanced products and services to secure users, networks and endpoints against ransomware, malware, exploits, phishing and the wide range of other cyberattacks. Sophos provides a single integrated cloud-based management console, Sophos Central – the centerpiece of an adaptive cybersecurity ecosystem that features a centralized data lake that leverages a rich set of open APIs available to customers, partners, developers, and other cybersecurity vendors. Sophos sells its products and services through reseller partners and managed service providers (MSPs) worldwide. Sophos has major hubs around the globe. More information is available at www.sophos.com

Role Summary
As the SAP Applications QA Engineer, you will work with a high-performance collaborative team of Developers and Testers, ensuring that the approach and delivery of all aspects of the team’s work aligns with departmental policies.
You will be a hands-on part of the team for the testing of the company’s IT applications such as Salesforce and SAP; to test Integration layer processes within Mulesoft and Service Layer.
You will also ensure that the quality of all deliveries made by the team meets the defined criteria and engage with groups across the business to enable their team to effectively deliver products and updates that meet customer requirements and expectations.
What You Will Do
Suggest process improvement plans and execute it to departmental standards

Engage with BA & TAs to clarify business requirements and offer recommendations for improvements

Responsible for designing and executing on the test plan and strategy
Work with Team Lead/QA Lead to provide support and recommendations regarding testing approach for work being delivered
Peer review test cases and provide guidance to other members when necessary
Proactively contribute in test execution and monitors it for reporting within the team
Work towards the complete delivery for a small project(s) with minimal support
Hands-on involvement in testing
Ensure quality of releases through Test-Driven Development and test coverage reviews
Lead Root Cause Analysis investigations. Identify trends and areas of weakness, and drive corrective actions
Contribute to and deliver against the wider team priority list
Other duties and responsibilities as directed
What You Will Bring
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or similar
2+ years of solid experience working in a QA team
Effective communication skills with colleagues and business stakeholders
Excellent written and verbal English communication skills
Excellent technical problem-solving skills
Effective in performing QA testing across multiple systems
Knowledge in Security Best-Practices
Ability to manage and resolve conflicts

Desirable:
1+ years’ experience in automated testing
Experience working with SAP, Worksoft and Salesforce
Exposure to AWS technologies
Risks Assessment and Mitigation exposure
Automation tools
Continuous Integration / Continuous Delivery

Job Description

Who are we looking for?
The Network Engineer – supports, maintains and develops the network, enhancing and making improvements where appropriate. Proactively monitoring and managing the performance of critical equipment and services, including network equipment and VM environments, identifying, recommending and applying solutions to resource issues.
Keeping in mind the security issues of the organization, are always be prepared to design and implement security countermeasures, when network vulnerabilities arise.
The Network Engineer is responsible for installing routers, Switches, and Firewalls as well as any other hardware and software upgrading that are essential for communication networks to function properly. The Network Engineer plans and executes the layout of cables and other required components for network systems. They maintain and troubleshoot network systems, resolves and rectifies if any issues occur.
The Network Engineer will manage existing networks and monitor the traffic. They are required to also work in coordination with the software and hardware teams to get the necessary network equipment in place. The Network Engineer will work in collaboration with network engineers, systems administrators and other professionals in network setup and configuration. They have to assess the existing network technologies to increase the performance, security & efficiency. They are also required also examine and evaluate the network performance and will make changes wherever required.

Qualifications

Essential
A minimum of 5 years hands-on experience as a Network Engineer
Practical experience in the administration and support of a multi-site network or in a similar technical support capacity
Knowledge/Experience in Cisco Campus and Data Centre Switching (Catalyst 6800, 9300/9200, 3850, 2900, Nexus9k), Routing (ASR1k, ISR4k, 3900, 2900) and Wireless (WLC, WAPs) technologies
Knowledge/Experience in Cisco Security solutions such as Cisco NGFW and IDS/IPS (ASA and Firepower Threat Defense), Cisco WSA (Web Security) for Internet Access Filtering, Secure Endpoint (AMP for Endpoints), Cisco AnyConnect VPN Client
Knowledge/Experience in VoIP (Voice Over IP) platforms and technologies, Cisco Unified Comms (CUCM, CUC, IM&P, Exchange Messaging Integration), ISDN PRI and SIP trunks and CUBE/SBC gateways
Working knowledge/experience in LAN/WAN technologies and solid understanding of networking across an MPLS/IPVPN environment
Experience working with MS DNS, DHCP, IIS, or NPS technologies
Experience in change management and ITIL based ticketing systems like Service Desk
Strong diagnostic and troubleshooting skills with systematic approach in identifying faults and pursuing paths to resolution
Self-starter, able to work as part of a team and independently work without supervision
Capable of managing complex technical issues, multi-task between priorities and provide communication updates
Ability to thrive in a fast paced, multi-cultural, customer-oriented environment
Excellent documentation and communication skills
Minimum level of certification achieved - Cisco CCNP – Routing & Switching, Security or Voice
Desirable
BA/BS in a computer or engineering related field or related certification
Previous experience in a Contact Centre/BPO or Telecommunications industry is desirable
Knowledge and understanding of virtualization technologies particularly VMware is desirable
WAN acceleration such as Riverbed Steelhead/SteelFusion experience
Threat hunting and “pentesting” experience
Asterisk or Linux based PABXs experience
Ongoing commitment to extending skills through self-study and training

integrated reporting tools to support ongoing program optimization to ensure clients always get “best buy on the day” rates

Formally established in 2017 as a dedicated entity within CWT specializing on hotel, RoomIt provides global business travellers with secure, cost-effective, policy-compliant, multi-channel, bookable hotel reservation solutions.
The Site Reliability Engineer is responsible for ensuring our Hotel Booking Platform is fast, stable and optimized for our customers. SRE’s at RoomIt by CWT take on availability, performance, managing change, monitoring, response and are guardians of non-functional requirements.
You either have an infrastructure background with a programmatic, automated mindset or are someone that comes with a software engineering background with infrastructure experience. The SRE goal is to build automated systems that reduce or eliminate manual work to keep our products up and running and performing optimally. We are looking for someone who thrives on collaboration within the team and across other groups and can operate independently to deliver solutions.
Main Responsibilities:
Champion and implement a culture of SRE to maintain a high-quality platform infrastructure
Champion and implement application and infrastructure monitoring and alerting to prevent client impacting issues by ensuring system availability, performance and scalability to maintain SLOs and SLAs
Optimize application performance at scale
Automate everything including system operational runbooks
Define and support continuous integration and deployment pipelines (CI/CD) aligned to branching and quality assurance strategies
Dive deep into technology and stay on the forefront of the latest tools, technologies, and strategies; help evaluate, prototype, and integrate them into work processes
Perform with broad independence and deliver on project milestones and tasks on schedule while communicating progress regularly
Build strong relationships with SRE team members and software engineering teams to hold each other accountable for quality expectations
Learn continuously and apply lessons learned
Evangelize best practices, eliminate bottlenecks, and improve process
Provide Tier 2 production incident management support and perform root cause analysis

Qualifications

Experience
Bachelor’s degree in computer science or other highly technical, scientific discipline
Experience writing software in any modern software language such as C#.NET, Java, Javascript, Node.js, React.
Experience creating automated deployments with tools such as AWS DevOps Pipelines, Ansible, Jenkins or other scripting languages to manage infrastructure, software build and deployment in a continuous integration (CI) environment
Experience writing scripts in PowerShell or Python/Bash to automate system operations as runbooks for Windows and Linux environments.
Experience implementing production performance, availability, and scalability monitoring and alerting best practices using a tool such as AppDynamics, New Relic, Dynatrace, AWS Cloudwatch, or DataDog
Experience as a global admin of AWS / public and private cloud technologies
Experience supporting public client facing revenue generating systems

Job Description:
As a Site Reliability Engineer (SRE), you will work at the intersection of production operations, softwaredevelopment and DevOps, as you monitor, manage, and improve production-critical infrastructure anddata pipelines. You will handle sophisticated proprietary software, as well as mainstream open-sourcetechnology as you gain experience maintaining and scaling critical fault-tolerant, distributed datapipelines, storage and compute infrastructure.
Our SREs work on exciting real-world problems and collaborate with smart (and fun!) colleagues in anempowering, performance-minded environment. The position presents long-term career opportunities withseveral trajectories depending on your interests and strengths, including senior SRE roles, as well asDevOps, software development, or technical leadership roles. This role is a way to make a real difference: your contributions will make our critical systems more reliable, lower operational risk, and increase the efficiency of our engineering effort.

Monitor production systems, triage and resolve failures, including our proprietary data pipeline, aswell as infrastructure and deployment processes

Gather and analyze metrics to help identify inefficiencies and guide architecture and development work

Experience with Linux Familiarity with Relational Databases & SQL Sharp analytical and problemsolving skills and a persistent drive for making things work (better)

Leave credits you can enjoy for vacation and travels with family because we believe that work-life balance matters!

About Marcel Project:
Marcel is the AI platform that connects more than 80,000 employees at Publicis Groupe— across geographies, agencies and capabilities. Marcel helps our employees learn, share, create, connect
and grow more than ever before. Marcel connects employees to our culture, helps them master new skills, inspires them and tackles diversity and inclusion head on to help build a better world together. It’s a place where we come together every day to amplify each other as one global team.

Key Responsibilities:
Reporting to the Supervisor, the successful candidate will be responsible for leading the conduct of evaluation of major transmission asset life and condition in the Mindanao Region, development of asset replacement philosophy and assessment methodology, data gathering and internal coordination, preparation of Project Application Documents with project justifications and CAPEX program for submission to Energy Regulatory Commission; and leads the conduct of project planning activities for various transmission line, substation, switching station, cable terminal station, customer grid connection and island interconnection projects and future developments in the existing power network of the Mindanao Grid.
Transmission Asset Planning and Development: Ensures the effective and efficient planning to provide adequate, reliable and quality power and to optimize the capital investment of asset replacement projects of the Mindanao Grid.
Participates the reconnaissance survey of proposed transmission line route, substation/ switching station or cable terminal station sites, underground cable routes and desktop study of submarine cable routes
Conducts the actual field investigations to identify the most ideal connection scheme for substation expansion, upgrading, replacement and generator/load customer projects
Develops the asset replacement philosophy and assessment methodology
Monitors the asset life for each major equipment based on established asset database to assess the appropriate program for asset replacement and rehabilitation
Prepares the planning layouts of new substation/switching station/cable terminal station, island interconnection, customer grid connection, and existing asset expansion/rehabilitation/ replacement projects based on the result of field investigations
Coordinates the Engineering Design Department for the preparation of Bill of Quantities and Engineering Cost Management Department for the preparation of planned cost estimates for asset replacement projects
Prepares the disbursement schedules for asset replacement projects as input in the Project Application Documents
Coordinates the Department of Public Works and Highways, Department of Transportation, Toll Regulatory Board and other related/attached agencies for the possible co-location of NGCP power transmission projects with their infrastructure projects
Coordinates the other groups to harmonize all planning-related aspects of transmission lines, substation and island interconnection projects
Coordinates continuously the O&M and SO for updates on equipment conditions that can already prompt asset replacement even within the period of economic life
Creates, maintains and regularly updates the database on existing transmission network facilities which will serve as an essential tool in project planning activities
Develops the program for asset phase-in/phase-out for transmission lines, substation and major equipment for inclusion in the TDP
Prepares the information for the proposed various transmission projects for documentation in the Transmission Development Plan (TDP) report
Prepares the justifications and other information for the proposed grid asset replacement for documentation in the TDP reports
Regulatory Approval Management of Asset Replacement Projects: Ensures the ERC approval of NGCP's proposed asset replacement projects through prudent justifications
Prepares the ERC project application documents and development plans and other supporting technical documents to ensure regulatory approval
Provides the relevant information, such as those matters relating to status of regulatory approvals, pre-construction/construction of grid replacement projects to groups within NGCP and other project stakeholder
NGCP Representation to Stakeholders Conferences: Uphold the TDP and programs of NGCP to protect its interest in the outside community for the benefit of the grid users and other stakeholders
Prepares and/or reviews relevant information, such as those matters relating to regulatory approvals and status of different projects to be provided to outside agencies, local governments, and other stakeholders
Prepares and/or reviews correspondences, presentation materials, and other reports related to transmission planning
Participates in conferences, consultation/coordination meetings, and regulatory proceedings related to transmission planning

4 years of relevant experience, 1 year of which in a Senior Engineer capacity
