About the company

First Circle is a financial technology company transforming small business commerce in the growth economies of Southeast Asia. Our mission is to radically improve economic circumstances for tens of millions of people. We’re doing this by building an all-encompassing trade & finance platform which provides our clients with payments, credit, and commerce tools to enable them to grow.
SMBs employ 67% of the labor force and contribute 45% of GDP. SMB growth has a large, lasting impact on the economy and the tens of millions of livelihoods they support. As the catalyst for SMB growth we create wealth for underserved segments, drive improvement in living standards and accelerate the expansion of the new middle class.

First Circle is a double-bottom-line business with a large commercial opportunity alongside our social mission. SMBs have an annual turnover of ~$2T in Southeast Asia and $350b in the Philippines alone. Our payments, credit, digital banking, and B2B e-commerce products transform the trajectory of small businesses and the mindset of their owners. Success means creating $ billions in wealth creation for our clients. Our product suite has something for all businesses, high margins, and large network and data lock-in effects. This is a $multi-billion opportunity.
About our culture. First Circle has a strong mission-driven culture. Our team is equally motivated by our social purpose, the intellectual stimulation of solving hard problems, and the commercial potential of our business.

At First Circle, a person’s trajectory is at least as important as their performance. We value youth and diversity because we believe that curiosity and boldness will bring us to the next level. We believe the best team dynamic is the combination of exceptional leaders who are both builders and coaches whose vision is carried out by a team of high potential, high-growth people whose intellect and ethics enable them to carry responsibility far beyond their years of experience. We categorize our culture as a “supportive meritocracy”. Supportive as we recognize that team’s output is multiple of the sum of individual parts. Meritocracy because the only thing that matters is the contribution to the customer, company, and community.

About the role
First Circle seeks an Infrastructure Engineer.

Today, First Circle has two products: Capital is a variety of flexible credit products to cater to the SMB’s funding needs, and Connect is a supplier payment and process automation tool.
We shall soon complete the acquisition of a bank license/charter in the Philippines which permits us to build a digital bank for our merchants - deposit & savings accounts, send & receive payments domestic & international, embedded credit - which we seek to deliver in Q2 2022. Secondly, we’re building B2B e-commerce tools to bring our SMB customer base online. As an Infrastructure Engineer, you will join a diverse and goal-driven Engineering team in building world-class systems through infrastructure solutions.

The objectives of the Infrastructure Engineer are:
Developing Kubernetes-based Deployment, which enables us to scale faster and reduce cost
Integrating Passwordless & MFA with our authentication and authorization platform provider enables us to ease user’s log-in and secure their account
Reading, writing, and reviewing infrastructure code, with a focus on writing a maintainable and secured code that is easy to understand
Building a scalable and highly available infrastructure that follows operational best practices
Collaborating with the product team to find, define, and resolve architectural application bottlenecks
Working with other engineering stakeholders on resolving larger architectural blockers


Characteristics of a great candidate
You Are/have:
Outcome Ownership: Biased to solve problems and Measure the results and not hours: their performance depends on the magnitude of the problem solved and the quality of the solution created. Are honest about successes and failures for them to accurately assess reality and move forward.
Effective + Efficient = Solutions: Produces repeatable and effective solutions without any waste of time, resources, effort, or energy. Is resourceful - always considers Repeatability, Scalability, Efficiency, and Effectivity.
Expertise in their Field: Expert in their field. Displays a high level of knowledge or skills in a particular area.
Creative Minds: Creative in art or thinking. Imagines and delivers output and solutions that are original, fresh, and unique.
With at least 3-4 years of related work experience
Proficient with AWS, AZURE or GCP
Strong experience with production system monitoring & observability
Strong knowledge of testing principles


Bonus Points:
Specifically passionate about financial inclusion, social change in developing countries, and a mission-driven organization
Deeply interested in financial technology - digital payments, data-driven lending, and digital banking


Why you should apply

Join the company at an incredible time in our journey as we’ve survived a traumatic pandemic experience and are now perfectly poised to expand products and rapidly expand our userbase
Enjoy high levels of personal growth working with very smart, high performing people who have excelled at some of the world’s best companies, each of whom possesses high levels of personal integrity and will invest in your development
Build lifelong relationships as you play a long-term game with long-term people

Are you interested in joining a group of highly talented engineers working on a open source project that is solving challenging problems across big data analytics, machine learning and artificial intelligence? As customers continuously push the envelope for ways to extract value from data, Alluxio is driving innovation in data access and management for large scale distributed systems. Alluxio (a.k.a Tachyon Nexus) a project from AMPLab like Apache Spark and Mesos is charging full steam to help customers navigate the digital transformation. . The Alluxio team includes leaders, innovators, explorers, and risk-takers with extensive industry experience from top tech companies including Google, Palantir and VMWare and alumni from top computer science programs including CMU, Stanford and UC Berkeley. The company is backed by Andreessen-Horowitz and has been named as top 10 hot startups for 2018.

As a distributed systems engineer at Alluxio you will be responsible for evolving the state-of-the-art Alluxio ( also knows as Tachyon Nexus earlier) project. The work would involve solving challenging problems in the area of Distributed Data Services, Memory and data structure efficiency, Thread concurrency and locking optimizations, process coordination
and caching policies and implementation. The role would include developing innovative solutions for scaling systems to thousands of node and providing Data Durability and High Availability.

Software development experience in one or more general purpose programming languages including but not limited to: Java, C/C++, or Go.
Experience working with two or more from the following is a must: distributed and parallel systems, distributed storage systems, architecting large scale software systems, and/or security software development.
Excellent analytical and problem solving skills.
Working proficiency and communication skills in verbal and written English.
Preferred Qualifications
Master’s, PhD degree, further education or equivalent practical experience in engineering, computer science or other technical related field.
Proficiency in one or more general purpose programming languages including but not limited to: Java, C/C++, or Go.
Interest and ability to learn other coding languages as needed.
Experience contributing to and/or maintaining an open source project.
Ability and desire to work in a fast paced, collaborative and iterative programming environment.
Contributed or contributing to Alluxio.

Job Description
We are looking for world-class talent to join a crack team of engineers, product managers, and designers. We want people who are passionate about creating software that makes a difference in the world. We like people who are brimming with ideas and who take initiative rather than wait to be told what to do. We prize a team-first mentality, personal responsibility, and tenacity to solve hard problems and meet deadlines. As part of a small and lean team, you will have a very direct impact on the success of the company.
We are looking for talented and self-motivated Senior Salesforce developers to be part of the salesforce team supporting an implemented and highly customized Salesforce Organisation. The work involves custom development with Salesforce Lightning, Apex, and Visualforce on the Force.com platform. We also work on Sales, Service, Marketing Clouds, and Einstein Analytics.
You will work closely with business leaders and manage end-to-end implementation for these large change requests, and for any other further enhancements required that are integral to ensuring that the organization’s processes are smooth and efficient.
As a Salesforce engineer you will be responsible for:
Gathering requirements, solution, and design reviews, integration, and data approach, release management methodology, fit/gap analysis of product capabilities, adoption approach, and best practices related to use of the Salesforce.com platform and guidance around the adoption of Salesforce functionality.
Designing, coding, developing, integrating, and implementing enhancements to the Salesforce system.
Providing oversight of support for existing developed functionalities by support developers.
Preparing formal project documentation including requirements specifications, system design documents, Current & Future state diagrams, test cases, and user manual.
Participating in new initiatives/projects discussion with the business and converting them into an opportunity.
Job Requirements
A proven technical background, with at least 5 years of experience in implementation and support of secure, stable, and flexible tenant designs for Salesforce cloud product solutions with good exposure to SDLC processes
Salesforce certifications: Salesforce Admin, Platform Dev 1, and Service Cloud Consultant are preferred
Has experience in writing configuration documents, preparing technical and functional specification documents, and delivering documentation to be used for future reference
Skills in analyzing and resolving issues, including the ability to conduct related research and work with the end users to raise Salesforce Customer incidents as needed
Good communication skills (written and verbal), proven team player, rolling up the sleeves, and getting involved in the nitty gritty
Familiar with Agile Methodology
Able to work within the GMT+8 time zone

Job Description:
Check out this inspiring role in the Data & Analytics space and be a part of Vestas’ digital transformation journey supporting an innovative agenda across the company.

Data & Analytics is a strategic area within Vestas Global IT and is responsible for products and services related to business intelligence and big data engineering and data modeling. This ranges from traditional business intelligence (BI) to data ingestion from multiple sources, data storage, and front-end BI, where we enable our internal colleagues to perform data analytics.

Vestas Solutions > Data Management & Analytics > Master Data Governance

What’s in store for you?
We offer you an exciting possibility to attain responsibility for the network behind core products, to engage across a large truly global organization, and good opportunities for cross-disciplinary work and personal development.
An attractive salary & benefits package (including a retirement plan and fitness subsidy)
Good work-life balance and flexible work setup
A focus on growing your career path, new learnings & following your motivation
A culture that trusts empowers, and inspires people
A team is motivated by our core values of accountability, collaboration, simplicity, and motivation
An inclusive & diverse environment where you can feel confident that your voice can be heard

What you will be doing
As a Data Engineer, you will have an important role in our Data Platform Team, which focused on enabling internal customers to develop their analytics products. You will be implementing and developing pipelines to new projects and running solutions.
Build data pipelines to ingest data from data sources to our data platform
Add new tables to current pipelines
Ensuring the stability of the data pipelines
Root cause analysis and bug fixing
Monitor daily loads to the platform
Collaboration with the rest of the platform team on optimizing the overall platform

What you will bring along:
3+ years of experience in designing and building complex data processing systems

Experience in creating a performant infrastructure, e.g. with the Azure Suite
Experience in performing root cause analysis and identifying opportunities for improvement

A collaborative talent who wants to be a part of a global cross-functional team in an organization with personal, professional, and cultural diversity
Curious and interested in building value-creating and innovative solutions
Have a professional mindset to adapt to the ever-changing conditions of this area
Good communication skills combined with an innovative and problem-solving approach to getting the job done
Aspiration to learn and wanting to contribute to the common success of the team

Additional Information
We do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including before the advertised closing date. Please be advised to apply on or before the 30th of November 2022.

About Vestas
Vestas is the energy industry’s global partner on sustainable energy solutions. We are specialised in designing, manufacturing, installing, and servicing wind turbines, both onshore and offshore.
Across the globe, we have installed more wind power than anyone else. We consider ourselves pioneers within the industry, as we continuously aim to design new solutions and technologies to create a more sustainable future for all of us. With more than 145 GW of wind power installed worldwide and 40+ years of experience in wind energy, we have an unmatched track record demonstrating our expertise within the field.
With 29,000 employees globally, we are a diverse team united by a common goal: to power the solution – today, tomorrow, and far into the future.

Job Description:
We are looking to recruit an experienced Software Test Automation Engineer to join a diverse and innovative team responsible for developing and maintaining systems that underpin our Privileged Access Management (PAM) processes and controls.
In this role you will be part of product development team working closely with software engineers and product owners ensuring the quality of project deliverables, managing defects, and help in maintaining and improving test automation process.
You will join our Privileged Access Management (PAM) team, which is part of the broader Identity and Cyber Security department within the wider Technology division. The department is focused on preparing for, protecting against and responding to Cyber Security events.
Core Responsibilities:
Working with DevOps/test team and product owners analyzing test requirements, creating test plan, test cases in a structured and reusable format, automated test scripts for new features and requirements
Come up with effective and efficient test approach to ensure full test coverage
Timely execution of system tests, integration tests, regression tests, and performance tests in accordance with agreed test cases and test plans
Identity effective framework that can adapt on business needs
Develop automation script and framework to support web applications and APIs
Drive automation framework and tests for new applications as well as enhancement and maintenance of test scripts for existing applications
Collaborate with different stakeholders to deliver enhancements, changes, and project-related requirements
Help identify and address operational improvement, including elimination of manual processes, improving documentation, and advancing capabilities in addressing platform issues and defects.
Reporting bugs accurately and concisely, and timely follow up to resolution
Accurate and timely reporting of test progress, risks & issues
Maintaining test documents such as but not limited to Test scenarios, test data, test evidence in JIRA and Confluence
Continuous innovation thinking bringing in best practices and efficiency including but not limited to automation
Core Requirements:
3 to 5 years relevant work experience in software application testing, including
Manual Functional, Regression, and API testing
Automation Testing (at least 2 years)
Testing in an Agile and Scrum framework
Technology Experience:
Test Automation using Selenium Java and RestAssured Frameworks
At least 1 year experience in Java development
IntelliJ IDE or any IDE for automation scripting
Well versed with various version control systems like Git, SVN etc
Knowledge of continuous integration concepts and tool like Bamboo, Jenkins, etc
Worked on the following technology is an advantage:
TestNG
Cucumber
Maven or Gradle
UNIX
Splunk
SQL
Postman or JMeter
JIRA and X-ray
Confluence
Ability to develop complex automated flows using suitable data structures, conditions, loops etc applying strong analytical skills with attention to detail
Exposure to Agile development approach
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Strong client service orientation
Strong sense of ownership with a passion for testing and delivering quality software
Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work independently as well as a team player
Capable of working with ambiguity and coordinating with relevant stakeholders to obtain clarity on expectations
Capability to effectively relate how IT solutions contribute to business results
Highly self-motivated, flexible, adaptable and results oriented
Willing to work in different time zones, if required

About the Corporate Operations Group
The Corporate Operations Group brings together specialist support services in Digital Transformation & Data, Technology, Operations, Human Resources, Business Services, Business Improvement & Strategy, and the Macquarie Group Foundation. We deliver service excellence to ensure Macquarie is open for business, deliver on transformational change, invest in our people and have deep relationships with our customers.
Our commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
The diversity of our people is one of our greatest strengths, and in combination with our inclusive environment, it enables us to deliver innovative and sustainable outcomes for our people, clients, shareholders and communities. From day one, you'll be encouraged to be yourself and supported to perform at your best. If our purpose of ‘empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future’ is as inspiring to you as it is to us, please apply. With the right technology, support and resources, our people can work in a range of flexible ways.
We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. We encourage candidates to speak with a member of our recruitment team if you require adjustments to our recruitment process to support you, and the type of working arrangements that would help you thrive.

About Macquarie
A career at Macquarie means you’ll have the opportunity to develop and utilise new skills, explore interesting fields and do challenging work that will impact the lives of people around the world—whether it’s accelerating the green energy transition, helping sustain global food supplies, financing social housing projects or investing in essential infrastructure. At Macquarie, we’re empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future.
Our size and international presence means your work can take you anywhere—across business groups, disciplines, sectors and borders. With 18,000+ employees and offices in 33 markets around the world, we’re a truly global organisation.
You’ll be supported by a diverse team where the unique perspectives, ideas and experiences that all of our people bring are valued. You’ll be empowered to address unmet needs in our communities whilst advising and investing alongside our clients and partners. Working with us, you’ll have the opportunity to make a difference.
Macquarie is a global financial group providing clients with asset management, retail and business banking, wealth management, leasing and asset financing, market access, commodity trading, renewables development, specialist advisory, capital raising and principal investment.

JOB SUMMARY:
Responsible member to Assure Quality in formulating and documenting all processes and work operation of production and all other processes related to the product line assigned.
Implement and monitor procedures, processes and policies and make sure it is being followed in accordance to the Environmental and Quality Management System.
Formulates Countermeasure to avoid or lessen occurrences of defects on products and process non-compliance in coordination with all involved members.
Attends to all inquiries made by clients and suppliers concerning quality.
Check and Monitor the application of quality activities and the effectiveness of corrective actions and its implementation to items with similar processes to avoid the same problem from happening.
Shall maintain the positive and professional communication and relationship with customers and members of the company.
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
· In-charge in creation of quality processes guidelines and work instructions in coordination with Production, Quality Control and Process Quality Engineers
· Responsible in Standardization of Created Quality Documents and evaluate its adequacy in the process.
· Formulate forms and identify sampling procedures and directions for recording and reporting quality data.
· Review the implementation and efficiency of quality and inspection systems
· Plan, conduct and monitor testing and inspection of materials and products to ensure finished product quality
· Document internal audits and other quality assurance activities
· In-charge in receiving and facilitation in resolving customer complaints and responsible in the information of all quality issues being received from Customers or Suppliers
· Collect and compile statistical quality data related to customer complaints
· Analyse data to identify areas for improvement in the existing quality system
· Recommend, Develop and monitor corrective actions and Improvement Plans.
· Responsible in Reports Preparation to communicate the outcome of Quality Activities
· In-charge in Quality Trainings and Identification of training needs as well as coordination of training intervention of members involved to meet quality standards.
· Serve as Company representative and attends inquiries regarding quality issues for both internal and external related quality concerns.
· Coordinates and support on-site audits conducted by external providers and evaluates audit findings then coordinate and implement appropriate corrective actions with all involved areas.
· Monitor risk management activities and Assure compliance with quality and industry regulatory requirements.
· Process Change Application, Monitoring and Verification- Check the applied process change if properly executed, verification of the 3 consecutive production lots for the process or 3 consecutive preparation and delivery of the changed 4M.Maintain records of 4M based on Record Control Procedure.
· Verification of monthly rejection rate report's quality activities - checking and verification if reported Quality Activities are being implemented and verification of its effectiveness.
· Conducts Failure Analysis - supports internal failure analysis as needed in the section’s in root cause analysis and investigation of customer claims.
· Issuance of Non-Conformance Reports Internally and to Suppliers, monitoring and checking of its corrective actions.
· Performs other duties as maybe assigned by superiors.
Management
· Responsible to meet departmental productivity and quality goals
· Ensures that section’s reportorial requirements are communicated with the supervisor, accomplished accurately and submitted on time. Ensures that all confidential information and documents are strictly maintained
· Ensure that the quality and environmental policy is faithfully followed; 5S and safety procedure especially using of PPE’s are strictly practiced
· Effectively carry out duties and responsibilities to the level of your command.
· Performs other duties as maybe assigned by the superior.
Communication
· Practices and maintains high level of professionalism and business ethics.
· Communicates effectively with all concern sections, co-worker and to immediate head.
· Provides necessary information across organization.
· Attends to cross-functional meetings and other coordination as necessary.
· Give advance information to member’s in-charge with regards to quality related details that maybe received from customers, suppliers and other sections.
· Proper communication and follow up of necessary requirements for customer requirements or corrective actions for customer complaints.
· Proper communication and Coordination to HR and other sections with regards to customer audits, visits and official businesses.
TRAINING REQUIRED
· Safety Training
· Company Rules and Regulations
· Quality Management System(QMS) and Environmental Management System(EMS) Awareness
· Core Tools Trainings such as but not limited to; Refresher Course for Advance Product Quality Planning (APQP), Failure Mode and Effect Analysis and Process Flow, Basic Statistical Process Control (SPC) Training, 5 Why and Root Cause Analysis
JOB SPECIFICATION
Education and Experience
· Graduate of four year course, Engineering graduate is an advantage. Preferably BS Industrial Engineer
· QC/QA experience acquired in the same manufacturing set-up.
· Quality inspection, auditing and failure analysis experience.
Competencies and Knowledge
· Analytical and detailed person can work both in office and production set-up.
· Computer Literate with good presentation skills.
· Competent and can work under pressure.
· Good oral and written communication skills.
Working Condition
· Responsibilities may require extended time in response to the need of the system and customer requirements.
· Prolonged exposure to electronics devices such as computers, copiers, fax machine etc.
· Constant roving and checking in the production areas for Process and Quality Activities verification.

Job Description

The DAM Engineer role will be responsible for implementations on the DAM platform of Aprimo within a large client context. You will work as an engineer together with a Senior DAM engineer/architect with a lot of experience. Together, you will implement the DAM according to client’s requirements, and you will be directly involved in the development, and testing of DAM projects.
You will report to a Merkle DACH team lead in either Switzerland or Germany. The position will include both working with project teams in an Agile environment and self-directed activities. The position’s responsibilities require independent analysis, communication, and problem solving. Work requires initiative, organization, and judgment.
Key responsibilities:
Gather and document metadata, assets storage, assets lifecycle and security requirements with business and technical stakeholders.
Implement metadata, workflows, and security requirements configuration across environments.
Serve as a SME & thought leader in the area of Digital Asset Management, being able to evangelise internally and externally the DAM problematics and challenges, as well as participate in pre-sales activities if necessary.

Qualifications
Has 2+ years experience with software development
Nice to have: 1+ year implementing and configuring DAM solutions with Aprimo or another DAM platform
Established basic knowledge in market leading DAM Solutions (Aprimo, Celum, Adobe AEM, Canto, or Bynder...)
Experienced with XML & JSON
Notions of system architecture related to DAM systems is a plus.
Advanced interpersonal skills and ability to work/learn as part of a team
Knowledge of ticket-based tracking system
Organizational, time management, and prioritization skills
Experience in providing confident and polite customer service
Process oriented mind, data-driven nature

Company Rating: 3.3 out of 5 stars from 864 employee ratings
Job Description:
Are you excited about DevOps and thriving in streamlining and automating traditional "operations" types of work? Do you have experience in monitoring and improving the engagement, scaling and robustness of cloud services (IaaS/PaaS)? If you are motivated to contribute to a better future through sustainable energy solutions and deliver industry-standard cloud services, you may be the right person to join our team of highly skilled and committed people!

As an SRE/Automation Engineer, you have the vast opportunity to create a real impact working in our Cloud Services & Core Infrastructure (CSCI). Within CSCI, Vestas launches an exciting journey to gather the best cloud skills in one place, provide and operate best-practice cloud services and shape the future of our enterprise IT solutions. We seek a highly hard-working SRE/Automation Engineer who desires to contribute to this journey actively and unlock the full cloud potential for Vestas.
You will be part of the Cloud Services & Core Infrastructure department which belongs to the User Productivity & Digital foundation (UPDF) area within Global IT. We develop and deliver strategies, roadmaps, and portfolios through a business case-focused approach to ensure that cloud consumption is being moved up the stack and that Vestas is accelerating on its cloud journey.

You will start by being a part of our Kubernetes team to assist and practice Site Reliability Engineering with a focus on cloud technology.

Global IT > User Productivity & Digital Foundation > Cloud Services & Core Infrastructure

Responsibilities
In your position as an SRE/Automation Engineer, your primary responsibility will be to:
Work towards automation and streamlining of "traditional" operations type of work (in collaboration with DevOps teams and business projects)
Monitor and improve the engagement, scaling and robustness of cloud services (IaaS/PaaS)
CI/CD orchestration, allowing Vestas DevOps teams to focus on delivery (e.g. automatically build commits, run tests, deploy to environments)
Perform and automate service orchestration (e.g. patching, monitoring, logging, etc)
Provide feedback regarding development or engineering methodologies, standards and established practices
Maintain and spread the DevOps culture and ways of working across Vestas

Qualifications
Experience in a similar role or operating experience in Cloud Services in a DevOps team
Comfortable with a range of programming languages and technologies (e.g. Terraform, ARM-template, cloud-native stack, Kafka, Containers/Kubernetes and YAML)
Solid experience working within at least one of the main cloud service providers (e.g. Azure or AWS)
Understanding of software development lifecycle methodologies & demonstrated DevOps skills
Experience with agile development methodologies such as Scrum, Kanban or SAFe
Coding/scripting knowledge for automation of infrastructure provisioning

Competencies
Working in our Cloud Capability Center naturally requires a solid technical understanding of the cloud. However, a good understanding of on-premise data center technologies is also beneficial as many cloud workloads are and will continue to be hybrid in nature and integrate with on-premise solutions. On a personal level, we expect that you have/are:
An open-minded and curious person with good communication skills combined with an innovative and problem-solving approach to implementing tasks
Aspiration to learn and ability to work with no supervision, efficiently and with persistence
Good cooperative skills suitable for a global organization with personal, professional and cultural diversity
Ability to take ownership and effectively engage in continuous improvements within a broader perspective
A team-oriented person who shows a focused approach to the tasks at hand and wants to contribute to the expected success of the team

What we offer
We offer you an exciting role with great professional and personal development opportunities in an inspiring, progressive, international work environment at an established manufacturer of wind turbines. We offer attractive company perks like fitness subsidy, health insurance, pension, life insurance, medical allowance, travel allowance, internet allowance, and some more. We have a modern, inspiring office overlooking Manila Bay, conveniently located near public transport. We believe in work-life balance and plan annual offsite outings, team building, and sports events throughout the year. In Vestas, you will experience an innovative environment where no days are ever the same, strengthening your personal as well as professional growth.

Additional Information
We do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including before the advertised closing date. Please be advised to apply on or before the 30th of November 2022.

Additional Benefits
Fitness Subsidy
Retirement Benefit Plan

About Vestas
Vestas is the energy industry’s global partner on sustainable energy solutions. We are specialised in designing, manufacturing, installing, and servicing wind turbines, both onshore and offshore.
Across the globe, we have installed more wind power than anyone else. We consider ourselves pioneers within the industry, as we continuously aim to design new solutions and technologies to create a more sustainable future for all of us. With more than 145 GW of wind power installed worldwide and 40+ years of experience in wind energy, we have an unmatched track record demonstrating our expertise within the field.
With 29,000 employees globally, we are a diverse team united by a common goal: to power the solution – today, tomorrow, and far into the future.
Vestas promotes a diverse workforce which embraces all social identities and is free of any discrimination. We commit to create and sustain an environment that acknowledges and harvests different experiences, skills, and perspectives. We also aim to give everyone equal access to opportunity.
To learn more about our company and life at Vestas, we invite you to visit our website at www.vestas.com and follow us on our social media channels. We also encourage you to join our Talent Universe to receive notifications on new and relevant postings.

Job Title: Product Engineer for Fresh Grads (BS and MS Degree)
Company Rating: 3.9 out of 5 stars from 808 employee ratings
Job Description:
Analog Devices (ADI) has just over $9 billion in revenue with offices around the world. As a global leader in the design and manufacturing of analog, mixed signal, power management and DSP integrated circuits, ADI is known for helping to solve its customers’ toughest engineering challenges. With a commitment to engineering for good, ADI strives to create a more sustainable future, while also focusing on its employees through mentoring programs, employee networks and continuous learning opportunities.
At ADI, you will learn from the brightest minds who are here to help you grow and succeed. You will make an impact through work on meaningful projects alongside a team of experts. ADI’s culture values aligned goals, work-life balance, continuous and life-long learning opportunities, and shared rewards.
Apply now for the opportunity to grow your career and help innovate ahead of what’s possible.
Job Description Summary:
Job Description:
ADI's Product Engineers apply their talents to solve challenging problems in a world-class manufacturing environment. We dig deep into various circuit architectures and collaborate across technical teams and boundaries to solve problems at their root.
This is an opportunity to join an international team of talented design, test, and process engineers while delivering innovative products to market with high quality and yield!
We mentor our product engineers to become technical leaders with a broad skillset and expose them to different semiconductor disciplines such as wafer fab and assembly processes, circuit designs, device physics, and test. Product Engineering resources include a state-of-the-art failure analysis laboratory, advanced IC design, and layout tools, and specialized statistical and yield analysis applications.
ADI is seeking a Product Engineer to support assigned IC products through the full product life-cycle. The assignment may be in
Maxim’s industrial, medical, cloud and data center, automotive, or mobility solutions groups.
Responsibilities may include, but are not limited to:
Yield Enhancement on a variety of analog and mixed-signal integrated circuits
Define the scope and impact of problems by identifying failure modes, the quantity of material affected, and defect density analysis
Perform electrical characterization of Maxim’s ICs in the lab using various bench tools
Perform die-level fault isolation and physical failure analysis to determine the root cause of yield loss
Drive resolution to problems that you identify with other groups such as fab, test, or design
Requirements:
Bachelor of Science / Master’s degree in Electronics and Communications Engineering / Electrical Engineering
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Ability to work collaboratively across engineering disciplines to solve problems
Ability to own and drive projects with minimal supervision
Preferred Qualifications:
Knowledge of analog integrated circuit design
With a background in Microelectronics
Ability to do circuit analysis and understand complex circuit functionalities
Familiarity with laboratory bench tools and operation
Education:
Work Experience:
Pay Rate Type:
Eligible for Relocation:
Eligible for Work Visa Sponsorship:
This position may require a deemed export control license for compliance with applicable laws and regulations; including but not limited to US Government International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR), US Export Administration Regulations (EAR), or US Treasury Regulations. If required, placement is contingent on Maxim’s ability to apply for and obtain an export control license on your behalf.
ADI is an equal opportunity employer. About Staizen
At Staizen, we live and breathe transformation. We support and guide our clients through the toughest and nitty-gritty parts of building, modernizing, and running digital products and platforms. Transformation is not easy and to be the best partners, we challenge ourselves to constantly practice what we preach in the way we do, build and lead.
The name Staizen is short for “State of Kaizen”, inspired by the Kaizen philosophy of continuous improvement. We are all about getting 1% better every day because sustainable transformation is not about the big bang but manifests in the daily choices that we commit to do every single day.
What we offer
Get the chance to work on transformation at scale missions for complex industries such as banking, e-commerce, insurance
Be part of our internal product development and build the next generation of productivity tools for customers
Be part of exciting communities where you can collaborate, grow and learn across the board
We are remote-first with global operations across France, Belgium, Luxembourg, Philippines, Singapore, and Cyprus, with optional co-working spaces for the team
Perks & Benefits
1% better yearly budget - your personal growth & learning fund
Co-working spaces - for the times when you want to spice up and change environments
Remote set-up budget - to get you up and running wherever you decide to work
Team-up budget - Monthly lunch/dinner budget for physical or virtual team bonding
Good medical coverage - so you don’t have to worry about your health
Flexitime - We follow the standard business hours, but we trust you to find your most productive time
Role
As a QA engineer in Staizen you are responsible for the creation of tests to identify issues for web applications and microservices. Your duty will include identifying and analyzing any bugs and errors found during the test phase and documenting them for review after.
Responsibilities
Design, code and implement automated tests for web, API and mobile applications
Develop and support the testing of product features throughout the entire development cycle
Contribute towards continuous improvement of testing practices/tools to improve test strategy and efficiency
Extend test coverage and close gaps through strategic test development using the test automation tools as required (E.g. Selenium, Cucumber, jUnit, TestNG, Mocha, Chai, Karma, Appium)
Guide and mentor fellow engineers in using the technologies as discussed in the job requirements
Work in collaboration with the different Engineering and Testing Teams to understand requirements and agree on acceptance criterion.
Document Test Strategy (functional and non-functional strategy) Closure reports and participate in project retrospection meetings.
Manage senior stakeholder expectations, articulate project challenges and progress.
Coordinate and monitor testing progression and prepare reports and communicate results and progress with project stakeholders including high quality documentation.
Participate in backlog grooming sessions and daily sprint meetings
Effectively communicate status, issues, and risks in a precise and timely manner
Assist in providing object-oriented programming concepts and designs whenever needed and possible
Requirements
Must have
7+ years of proven experience in QA testing
Hands-on experience with test automation tools and frameworks -- Cucumber, Webdriver, RestAssured
Strong understanding of software quality best practices and processes.
Experience with a broad range of testing practices
Knowledge of REST based web applications
Strong understanding of and experience with JSON, XML, HTTP including API testing
Strong proficiency in collaboration tools like Atlassian Confluence, JIRA and Microsoft Office suite
Hands-on experience on object-oriented programming languages (e.g. Java, C#, Typescript)
Good understanding of software foundation concepts and principles. (e.g. OOPs, SOLID)
Hands-on experience on build and dependency management tools; (e.g. NPM, Maven, Gradle)
Proficient with source code versioning tools, preferably git
Good understanding of database queries
Enterprise-level experience in the automation testing domain
Good to have
Knowledge on NodeJS and Typescript is a plus
Hands on experience on setting up CI/CD test pipelines
Experience in Performance Testing tools
Scripting knowledge (shell, bash)
Hands on experience on working with *nix based systems
Knowledge of JavaScript, CSS, Web sockets, Experience with Web UI frameworks –Angular, React JS
Hands on experience on virtualization tools e.g. VMs, Docker

Are you ready to drive impact and grow with us?
We’re looking for forward thinkers who thrive in an international environment. We have openings across our various communities - Frontend, Backend, DevOps, UX/UI, Quality
Assurance, Data & Analytics, and Engineering Management.
We can’t wait to meet you, drop us a message, and let’s chat!

Exegy is seeking a highly motivated, detail-oriented, and thorough QA Engineer to work remotely with other dedicated engineers in our Direct Market Access (DMA) team. The team is responsible for the development, test, and delivery of new product feature enhancements, fixes, and maintenance updates across a range of components.

You are already or will become a product and industry expert in key areas of the trading systems domain. You will work closely with QA team leads, software developers, and experts to develop test strategies, test plans, and test cases for automated and/or manual execution to ensure the high standard of product quality our customers expect. You will advance to mentor other team members in the domain, our products, and QA processes.

Accountabilities
Contribute to the full test lifecycle, including analysis & design, implementation, test execution, and release processes.
Application of proven QA techniques and experience working with teams to fully understand requirements, establish appropriate test cases, execute tests, and report on testing outcomes of functional and non-functional testing, boundary testing, and other exploratory tests as required to assure system stability and operation.
Following direction from team-lead and achieving defined goals.
Self-management of tasks and projects to agreed deadlines.
Developing knowledge of the trading systems domain and company products.
Work with cross-functional team members to advise and ensure appropriate QA occurs.
Strong client focus, with an emphasis on quality and stability in line with service level agreements.

We also require:
2 years of experience in software engineering and/or quality assurance.
2 years of experience in software development and test automation.
2 years Python and/or shell scripting experience.
2 years C++ programming experience desired.
Experience with other programming/scripting languages a plus.
Experience in QA of user interface based or API/programmatic based testing.
Excellent communication (written and verbal), interpersonal, and organizational skills.
Experience with continuous integration / continuous delivery desired.
Capital-markets and/or Financial Services knowledge (Trading, Market Data, protocols) desired.
Cross-platform experience (Linux and Microsoft Windows) desired.
Experience with financial, transactional, or message-based (e.g. FIX, FIXFAST, SBE) systems desired.
Practical Agile development knowledge and experience desired.
The position requires a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or a closely related field, or the foreign equivalent degree.

BASIC FUNCTION

Position Overview

The Associate Systems Engineer will be responsible for monitoring and administration of system and services that support the Managed Services Operations. You will play a vital role in ensuring that the technology infrastructure of internal and external clients runs smoothly and efficiently, alongside with the group of engineers within our department. The position also includes junior level administrating our Identity Access Management solutions

What you’ll do at Insight

The Associate Systems Engineer will be responsible for administrating systems and services that support the Managed Services Operations which includes monitoring tools, identity management systems, remote management solutions and infrastructure. The tools include ScienceLogic, Single Sign On solution, nCentral Remote Management Tools, ServiceNow, Netapp HCI, Azure, AWS, Cisco switches and Cisco firewalls

Acts as a resource person for other teammates in resolving incidents and other requests
Communicates with internal and external customers via chat, phone or email to effectively cascade information as needed
Creation of some technical documentations and procedures
Other duties as assigned

Familiarity with ITSM concepts and experience with ticketing system
Proven ability to communicate effectively across all levels of the organization
Strong commitment to company values and operating principles
One or more years of hands on experience with configurating SNMP, Syslog, and WINRM

Job Description:
PROFESSIONAL QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelor’s or College Degree in Civil Engineering, Architecture, or equivalent.
At least 6 months of experience.
Computer literate and well-versed with MS Office applications.
Proficient in operating Cad software.
Flexible and can work in longer hours.
GENERAL DUTIES AND ACTIVITIES:
1. Review the Material Technical Data Sheet:
Read all Material Data Sheet to be supplied to the Project, especially when the material is about to submit the o Engineer or Consultant.
Review properly the Material Data Sheet because sometimes the properties othe f material do not comply with the requirements of the specification, which can lead to rejected materials and will cause a waste of time and eventually create delays.
Make a recommendation to Site Management Team on how to meet the QA/QC compliance without compromising the milestone dates and handling responsibilities.
2. Preparation of Method Statement:
Develop a method statement for the work on the site.
Make sure that method is submitted to the Consultant and Project Manager, and should be approved prior to starting of job on the site.
Shall prepare the method statement ahead of schedule for the jobs and consider planning for all the method statements preparation and submission.
Prepara e test plan.
Initiate meeting orientation to workers on how the properworks must be done before deployment to site.
3. Review Method Statement approval or comments of the consultant and take action:
Upon receiving from Consultant or Client, the submitted Method Statement, review all comments or approval.
Any corrective action in the comments shall be immediately complie with and eventually revert for final approval.
Do not keep the comments on your hand for long period of time because the construction team cannot precede the works untithe l methods statement is finalized.
4. Submit Inspection Request for Inspection:
You shall make sure that the Inspection and Test Plan is approved before raising an inspection request.
Submit Inspection Request to the Client for approval of a particular job before proceeding with the succeeding work.
Make sure that the job to be inspected is completed so that there will be no revisions or rejection of the inspection.
The job will be inspected within the given commitment dates.
Create a reminder when Inspection Request is submitted because the Client will not accept any outright request for inspection.
5. Issue Internal NCR or Site Observation:
Issue an internal Non-Conformance Report and Site Observation to the Subcontractors and Site Construction Team, before issuing an NCR to the concerned trades.
Make sure to provide a Site Observation Report and give them at least a maximum of 48 hours to take action, and if there’s no action after 48 hours then you may issue an NCR.
6. Conduct Regular Site Inspection and Surveillance:
Conduct Daily Site inspections to assess progress status.
Bring Site Approved Plan for counter checking of site preparation and lay-outing works during the daily site inspection.
Check if the works on site are moving as per drawing, approved materials, method statement and as per quality control procedure.
Check the safety of people doing the work, you have the right to stop them from doing unsafe work, though it is the Safety Officers' task.
Reject anything that does not meet the company standard.
Ensure that all Incident reports have been validated by the owner or contractor.
Inspect or Test Materials for defects and deviation from specification.
7. Provide Documents needed in the Billing Attachment:
In charge of the documentation such as taking photos and preparing reports (punch list, handover, COC, etc.)
Validated Punch list.
Handover Reports.
Photos of Specific Cause of Delay with corresponding date and time.
Signed and approved shop drawings.
Highlighted critical plans reflecting the original work schedule versus the actual schedule (if necessary).
Delivery receipts of materials or equipment (if applicable).
Notice of Delay shall be made on Day 1 that one specific work on the Original Work Schedule has been delayed due to other trades/circumstances. And shall subsequently submit on regular basis reflecting the number of days delayed.
Revised Work Schedule must be approved by the Project Management Team in every revision of the Master Schedule.
All necessary documents must be submitted to Billing Department on weekly basis with a corresponding summary.
Extension of Time Cost will be submitted when a realistic projected date of completion will be established by the Site together with the documents mentioned above.
8. Prepare QA/QC Reports:
All the activities that were performed that week.
Critical issues encountered and noticed.
An incident occurs on site that may affect the quality of work.
The documents submitted and to be submitted shall also be included in the report to your Project Manager.

Job Description:
Service accountabilities:
Design – the design of the customer solution resides with the data engineer. In some case this will be a design encompassing only data components and can be completed by the data engineer. In other cases in a more complex environment the solution may involve the other areas of DXC's business, Voice, and Applications . In these cases the data engineer will work closely with the other disciplines to ensure the overall solution will work to the customers business requirements.

Network Changes – involvement in the planning and perform network changes to customer data networks during business and after hours. These will sometimes be done in conjunction with DXC Project Management, in which close liaison with the PM will be required. In other cases the data engineer will be responsible for rollout of the solution and/or the network changes. Working with the Network Operations Manager for resourcing the work appropriately and engaging other teams or any sub contractors where necessary.

Support - Provide network support to customers who have maintenance contracts or are paying T&M rates for maintenance with DXC Connect. This will include remote diagnostics via telephone and dial in to the customer network. Should onsite attendance be necessary the engineer will engage onsite engineers to attend site. Co-ordinate a field service person or sub contractor to attend. Ownership of fault resolution is with the network engineer through to completion.

Presales activity which includes scoping and quoting all data networking and security products and services in the DXC Data Networking portfolio. Engage with sales team which include presentations, design sessions and converting a customer business requirements into a technical solution.

Assist with some of the delivery of professional services on network design, commissioning, audit and implementation when required.
On call after hours support to customers when required.
Work with staff/vendors to test problems to come up with solutions to fixes, patches etc.
Verify the conformity of all the equipment in the customer solution
Prepare monthly customer network performance reports
Escalate issues to Vendors when required
Raise the quality of standards & quality of services offered, measured on Customer service. This will include closure time of problems, response times, & customer survey.
Be Aware of all costs & tracking. Adhere to the most economical solution in delivering services
Fully support & liaise with the service management team to provide solutions and develop internal and external processes.
Ensure all call log reports are completed, and closed within the guidelines required, and that all documentation is forwarded to Customer Support for billing. *Work with the team to ensure successful installations are completed, and customer satisfaction is maintained and increased.
Complete a weekly summary report and timesheet indicating hours spent each week and submit to Network Team lead.
Additional Responsibilities:
Promote the DXC image of a Company which guarantees customer satisfaction, in accordance with the strategy of the Company. Detect and seize every opportunity allowing to promote the Value Added Services activities, both internally and externally. Fully support & liaise with all other areas of DXC where required. Accept responsibility for own standard of performance and ensure quality results. Undertake duties in accordance with health and safety requirements demonstrating a duty of care to own self and others. Achieve company objectives in regard to service, sales and company growth Complete any other tasks/duties as required. Provide timely updates on all escalated Level 2/3 problems. Promote the DXC image to guarantees customer satisfaction, in accordance with the strategy of the Company.
